name: Embassy Suites Lubbock

reviews.text: We recently stayed two nights in room 251.
reviews.title: Great Stay for TT Graduation

likes.liked: — The nice atrium feel of the interior; happy hour and the breakfast
likes.disliked: — Doors could be more soundproof; noise in room from the bar

reviews.text: I thought I had booked a two bedroom suite, but ended up with a one bedroom (two double beds) and a pull-out queen-size couch. The room was clean and well stocked, and the beds and pillows were comfortable.
reviews.title: Great comfort

reviews.text: The only downside that I can think of as far as the room is concerned, was its location. It was directly over the bar. While the glass doors are a nice, homey touch, they're not very soundproof. My mother slept on the pull-out couch and heard a lot of noise until the bar shut down. If this is a concern, make sure to book further down the hall.
reviews.title: Love, love, love Embassy Suites Lubbock

likes.liked: — The free drinks at happy hour.
likes.disliked: — The people in the room next to ours were very noisy at night!

reviews.text: The free happy hour and full breakfast were both well utilized by our party! The breakfast was very nice. I expected a continental breakfast, but this far exceeded that. Eggs, bacon, sausage, grits, potatoes, fresh cut melons, pastries and an omelet station rounded it all out. There was also a juice station and Starbucks coffee.
reviews.title: Nice but could be excellent

reviews.text: I would have to say that this is probably the nicest of the existing hotels in the area and it is within a 5 - 10 minute drive to Tech.
reviews.title: One of the best in town

reviews.text: We arrived at the Embassy Suites at noon, and were told a room was unavailable, but would be ready in 20 minutes to one hour. One and a half hours later, the room was finally ready, but the cleanliness left much to be desired. On the coffee table, were numerous cup rings that still looked moist from the previous guest. When I walked
reviews.title: Good stay, but needs to work out some kinks.

reviews.text: into the bedroom, there was noticeable gunk on the curtain that should have been wiped off. As we were four people in the room, I promptly requested four extra bath towels, but
reviews.title: Nice and close to the Airport

reviews.text: was only brought three. I also requested feather pillows, but was brought foam.
reviews.title: I'll never book this one again!

reviews.text: The manager's reception was more ample than we expected, with baked ziti, chips and dip, and stuffed potato skins. The only problem was the buffet ran out of plates for the guests. There was full occupancy, and the staff should have been prepared for the number of guests. Breakfast was impressive, with a large selection, and some made to order items, though the staff lost my order for french toast.
reviews.title: Low Lighting in Areas at Embassy

likes.disliked: — Close to areas that we needed to access

reviews.text: I usually look forward to ending my evening by relaxing in the hot tub, but unfortunately, it was broken, so this was disappointing. It was nice to have access to a free business center, with two computers, and various supplies. There as a small fitness center, and was impressed that it offered free ear buds for the treadmill tv.
reviews.title: "Long way to go"

reviews.text: WOW, was so happy to "land" in this hotel after staying in a Holiday Inn all week.
reviews.title: Great Property

reviews.text: It felt like I moved uptown for sure! The staff is excellent, whoever is doing the training there, is doing it right. Super nice folks, comfort and room abound and wonderful food and drink. Can NOT say enough positive...Do NOT hesitate to stay here...
reviews.title: Best value possible

reviews.text: P.S. walls are a bit thin
reviews.title: Great getaway

reviews.text: My husband and I with our 3 kids (all 7 and under) just stayed at the Embassy for 4 nights and I have to say, we were very impressed. We have stayed in a lot of hotels, and this one had to be the best value for our money hands down. The staff were friendly and accomodating. The housekeeping was the best we have ever had because of their attention to detail every day. The breakfast was outstanding. The pool area was updated and very clean. The rooms were large enough to accomodate the 5 of us comfortably. Although the bathroom was small, we appreciated having the large bathroom vanity/sink area in the bedroom. I could not find one complaint about this hotel and would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Well worth every penny

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our family, with 8 & 5 year olds had a great time. We've had friends stay at the Lubbock Embassy Suites, with great reviews. The room was perfect, well equipped and clean - excellent wi-fi. We took advantage of the indoor pool throughout the stay. The entire staff was FRIENDLY and always greeted us. We could have chosen to eat free at the managers' reception (5:30-7:30), but took advantage of Canaletto's restaurant in the hotel - great service and dinner (online menu not uptodate). The complimentary full breakfast was better than majority of restaurants. We will certainly look for Embassy Suites for our future destinations.
reviews.title: Away From It All

reviews.text: We have now stayed here twice this year and both times have been excellent. We went to visit my daughter, who is a student at Texas Tech. Upon checking online we found that there were no rooms available for Friday night. I decided to give them a call and talked to a very nice man named Omar. He told me that there were several rooms that were opening up, took my cell number, and promised to call me back when they were ready. About 2 hours later we heard from them and were given a room. Upon first entering the room, I was a bit concerned because of its location. It was located on the first floor, right behind the lounge area & bar. However, there was no problem either night. The bar does close at 11:00 pm so we had no trouble sleeping. We could not hear any noise in the bedroom area.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Room was clean as always. The only problem was with some beer left behind in the fridge. Service at the front desk was quick and efficient. Everyone we met was very professional and friendly.
reviews.title: Always a nice stay

reviews.text: The breakfast was outstanding as usual. The first morning I had a made-to-order omelet and bacon. The second I chose eggs, potatoes & fruit from the buffet. Both times food was delicious and hot. There was also plenty of additional items on the buffet, including pastries, cereals, breads, milk, juices & coffee.
reviews.title: Terrible...poor service

reviews.text: All in all this was an exceptional stay for our extended family. We look forward to staying here in the future.
reviews.title: Elegant and cozy

reviews.text: Great for a business traveler. I've stayed there several times and the rooms are always clean and hotel staff is friendly. I like having 2 rooms and more space than the average hotel room Free high speed internet makes it easy to get work done while away. The location is great and close to restaurants. The only disadvantage is room service. I've only ordered once but the food was not very good. I would recommend going out to one of the places nearby for food.
reviews.title: Very Dissappointed!

description: Welcome to the Embassy Suites Lubbock hotel, the only all-suite hotel located in Northwest Texas. Truly a landmark of its own, this Lubbock, Texas, hotel boasts an unforgettable lobby featuring a Tuscan-style open-air atrium with lush tropical plants, a striking koi pond, and calming waterfalls, planned with your sensory experience in mind. This premier hotel is nestled among the excitement of the South Plains Mall and minutes from Lubbock's medical centers, Texas Tech University, and the City of Lubbock Convention Center.
